Detailed Description

CM Class.

This class provides four coded modulation schemes:

  • TCM, TTCM, BICM and BICMID.

Modulation modes available are M-QAM and M-PSK, where M=2^n is the modulation level. We have:

  • 4-QAM, 16-QAM, 64-QAM (CQAM)
  • 4-PSK, 8-PSK, 16-PSK, 64-PSK (CPSK)

Interleaver types available are:

  • symbol interleaver (ON, OFF) for TCM, TTCM
  • internal parallel bit interleavers for BICM and BICMID (always ON for BICM & BICMID)
  • IQ interleaver (IQ_INTLV) for TCM, TTCM, BICM, BICMID

Decoding in logarithmic domain is performed: decoder_type available are CM_EXACT_LOG_MAP, CM_APPROX_LOG_MAP, CM_MAX_LOG_MAP.

To set up a rate-3/4 (k=3, n=4) 16QAM TTCM having code memory 3, code termination, 4 turbo iteration, CM_APPROX_LOG_MAP decoder, 100 coded symbols (no_of_symbols), employ IQ-channel interleaver; the following code can be used: 

  CM cm;
  cm.set_parameters(TTCM,3,4,3,ON,4,CM_APPROX_LOG_MAP,100,CQAM,IQ_INTLV);
  cm.initialise();
See cm_test.cpp for more details.

Warning:
  • Modulation level = 2^n
  • Make sure that n=k+1; so that when compared CM to uncoded scheme
    1. the modulation level is doubled but
    2. experience no bandwidth expansion
  • no_of_info_bits=no_of_info_symbols*k, where
    1. no_of_info_symbols=no_of_symbols
      if Terminated=OFF for all CM schemes
    2. no_of_info_symbols=no_of_symbols-L
      if Terminated=ON for TCM, BICM & BICMID
    3. no_of_info_symbols=no_of_symbols-2*L
      if Terminated=ON for TTCM

void CM::set_parameters ( const int  mode_in,
const int  k_in,
const int  n_in,
const int  L_in,
const int  Terminated_in,
const int  iterations_in,
const int  decoder_type_in,
const int  no_of_symbols_in,
const int  modulation_type_in,
const int  interleaver_mode_in 
)

Setup parameters for the CM encoder/decoder and also calculate the bit and symbol block lengths.

Parameters:
mode_in CM.mode: TCM, TTCM, BICM, BICMID
k_in dataword length
n_in codeword length
L_in code memory length
Terminated_in code termination: OFF, ON
iterations_in turbo iteration number, for TTCM and BICMID
decoder_type_in decoding type: CM_EXACT_LOG_MAP, CM_APPROX_LOG_MAP, CM_MAX_LOG_MAP
no_of_symbols_in number of coded symbols in a block
modulation_type_in modulator type: CPSK, CQAM
interleaver_mode_in interleaver mode: OFF, ON, IQ_INTLV (internal bit interleaver for BICM or BICMID is always ON)
Warning:
  • Modulation level =
  • Make sure that n_in=k_in+1; so that when compared CM to uncoded scheme
    1. the modulation level is doubled but
    2. experience no bandwidth expansion
Note:
  • k=k_in, n=n_in, L=L_in
  • if Terminated is OFF:
    1. no_of_info_symbols=no_of_symbols_in
  • if Terminated is ON:
    1. no_of_info_symbols=no_of_symbols_in-2*L (TTCM)
    2. no_of_info_symbols=no_of_symbols_in-L (TCM, BICM & BICMID)
  • no_of_info_bits=no_of_info_symbols*k
  • no_of_coded_bits=no_of_symbols*n
  • no_of_tail_bits=(no_of_symbols-no_of_info_symbols)*k

void CM::initialise (  ) 

Initialise CM: allocate memory and initialise coder, modulator (modulation ) & interleaver.

Note:
  • tcm , ttcm and bicmid employ SP based signal mapping
  • bicm employs GRAY coded signal mapping
  • interleaver tables will be generated and stored in files.

  • length of b_Input_bits=no_of_info_symbols*k
  • length of i_Output_bits=no_of_symbols*n

int CM::decode_using_Pr ( bvec &  b_decoded_bits,
mat  Pr 
)

CM decoder: channel deinterleave and decode.

Parameters:
b_decoded_bits decoded bits (binary vector)
Pr matrix of the channel symbol probability
In this function, the CM's demodulator is not used to calculate the channel symbol probability. Useful when the equaliser/space-time decoder was used to calculate the channel symbol probability.
Note:
  • data symbol a-posteriori probability updated and stored in
    1. map->Apo (TCM, TTCM)
    2. siso->Apo_dataword (BICM, BICMID)
  • coded symbol a-posteriori probability updated and stored in
    1. OPr (TCM, TTCM)
  • coded bit extrinsic-probability updated and stored in
    1. siso->Apo_coded_bit (BICM, BICMID)

int CM::decode_using_PrIQ ( bvec &  b_decoded_bits,
mat  PrI,
mat  PrQ 
)

CM decoder: channel deinterleave and decode.

Parameters:
b_decoded_bits decoded bits (binary vector)
PrI matrix of the channel symbol probability
PrQ matrix of the channel symbol probability
In this function, the CM's demodulator is not used to calculate the channel symbol probability. Useful when the equaliser/space-time decoder was used to calculate the channel symbol probability. This function is used for the IQ-interleaved system.
Note:
  • data symbol a-posteriori probability updated and stored in
    1. map->Apo (TCM, TTCM)
    2. siso->Apo_dataword (BICM, BICMID)
  • coded symbol a-posteriori probability updated and stored in
    1. OPr (TCM, TTCM)
  • coded bit extrinsic-probability updated and stored in
    1. siso->Apo_coded_bit (BICM, BICMID)

ivec &  symbols,
int  N,

)

decode symbol based on symbol's a-poteriori probability

Based on data symbol's a-poteriori probability, symbol block length and number of possible different input symbols, the most likely input data symbol sequence is given.

M number of possible different input data symbols (2^k)

get generator polynomial and puncturing pattern from a predefined table for BICM/BICMID

Based on k and L , the appropriate generator polynomials are loaded into GenPoly of BICM_parameters. Punturing pattern on a rate-1/2 mother code for yielding a rate-5/6 BICM coder is loaded into puncture of BICM_parameters.
